Word.Root: To dislike. Find Hateful. To compel. Repugnant. Compulsion as in: There is no compulsion in religion.

Meaning.Definition: كَرِهَ aor. يَكْرَهُ inf. noun كُرْهًا and كَرْهًا كَرِهِهٗ:He did not desire it, disapproved it, was displeased with it, hated him or it. Contr. of حَبَّهٗ وَ اَحَبَّهٗ .
Meaning.Example: Token(61:10:12:14): Though the idolaters hate it (61:10).
Token(49:8:21:23): He has made disbelief hateful to you (49:8).
اَكْرَهْتُهٗ عَلٰى كَذَا : I compelled him to do such a thing.
Token(20:74:7:9): Which thou didst compel us to use (20:74).
Token(2:217:4:6): And it is repugnant to you (2:217).

Meaning.Definition: Unwilling. كَارِهَةٌ act. pass. كَارِهِيْنَ and كَارِهُوْنٌ plural of كَارِهٌ مَكْرُوْهٌ pass. part.

Meaning.Example: Token(17:39:6:7) from اَكْرَهَ and means, hateful (17:39).
Token(2:257:1:4) meaning there is no compulsion in religion (2:257).
